GameModel

Class GameSimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel.GameSimulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is in charge of managing the mobs in the MUD. It creates them on startup and start's their run methods. It also handles the respawning of the mobs
    Author:
    Mazen Shihab, Matthew Latura, Michael Hogue
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      World w
      The World that has the GameSimulation running.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameSimulation(World w)
      The constructor for this will spawn Mobs in their appropriate starting locations within the passed World object and adds them to the mobs list

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void mobDied(Mob m)
      This removes the passed mob from the mobs list.
      void start()
      Iterates through the list of mobs and starts their behavior threads
      void startRespawns()
      This method starts the threads responsible for respawning mobs.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • w

        public World w
        The World that has the GameSimulation running.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameSimulation

        public GameSimulation(World w)
        The constructor for this will spawn Mobs in their appropriate starting locations within the passed World object and adds them to the mobs list
        Parameters:
        w - - the World in which to spawn the mobs

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Iterates through the list of mobs and starts their behavior threads

      • mobDied

        public void mobDied(Mob m)
        This removes the passed mob from the mobs list. It also will spawn 3 baby spiders on top of a dead Giant Spider if it is the passed mob
        Parameters:
        m - - the dead mob

      • startRespawns

        public void startRespawns()
        This method starts the threads responsible for respawning mobs. Each thread will wait a certain amount of time and then count how many instances of each mob type are in the mobs list. If the number found is less than a certain value then it will respawn a new instance of that particular mob. Seperate threads are responsible for different tiers of mobs as weaker mobs should respawn more often then more powerful ones
